snippet: Because of a disagreement between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, a museum at ground zero will not open even by next year’s anniversary of the attacks.
abstract: Dispute between New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg and New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo over operating costs for the $1 billion museum at ground zero has dragged on for so long that it will not open even by the 2013 anniversary of the attacks; delay may mean that the museum will not open before construction on 1 World Trade Center is finished in early 2014.
lead_paragraph: Because of a disagreement between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, a museum at ground zero will not open even by next year’s anniversary of the attacks.

headline.seo: Bloomberg-Cuomo Dispute Delays Opening of Sept. 11 Museum
headline.main: Dispute Over Costs Delays Opening of 9/11 Museum
headline.print_headline: Dispute on Costs Delays Opening Of 9/11 Museum

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
